page.title: 05CHICKEN FARMING/S.ELKINGTON
page.content: Deighton Close Farm farms 56 hectares with wheat,barley,potatoes,rape,peas, grass and 40 head of cattle.24,000 battery chickens in 6 poultry houses, costing Â£36 per 100 day old chicks kept for 76 weeks. Each bird lays 280 eggs in 56 weeks.2 women are employed in poultry houses.Eggs collected and sent to packing station. 4 men employed on this, and Fanthorpe Farm.Buildings include potato store, implement shed, and a grain store.The proposed Louth by-pass will cut this farm in half. Church Farm _ 104 hectares, growing wheat,barley,oil seed rape,rye grass, and dried peas.There are 20 fattening cattle and 150 lambing ewes kept on grassland, some of it reclaimed from disused sand and gravel pits.
